Functions
Credentials_Input
void Credentials_Input(
Member_credentials *ADHERANT_CREDENTIALS,
FILE *pFILE_DATABASE
)

This functions is used to take a valid credentials input from the member:

It has 3 main responsibilities :

  • It Checks whether the Login and the password are valid or not

  • Hides the password on input

  • Encrypts the password

Parameters
ADHERANT_CREDENTIALS
Member_credentials*

The structure of the members which will be holding the credentials.

pFILE_DATABASE
FILE*

The pointer to the Credentials database used to check the validity of the Login (Not taken)

See Also

CHECK_IF_LOGIN_TAKEN / CHECK_IF_PASSWORD_IS_NON_VALID  / HIDE_PASSWORD / Encrypt_Password

Infos_Input
void Infos_Input(
Member_infos *ADHERANT_INFOS
)

This functions is used to take valid infos input from the member i.e: "Firstname ,Adress , Phonenumber..."

Parameters
ADHERANT_INFOS
Member_infos*

The structure of the members which will be holding the infos.

CHECK_IF_LOGIN_TAKEN
int CHECK_IF_LOGIN_TAKEN(
FILE *pfile,
char *Login
)

Search within the the credentials database to check if the Login exists already

Parameters
pfile
FILE*

The pointer to the file.

Login
char*

The Login of the member

Returns
if the Login is taken

Returns 1

if not

Returns 0

CHECK_IF_PASSWORD_IS_NON_VALID
int CHECK_IF_PASSWORD_IS_NON_VALID(
char *password
)

Take the password as a parameter and browse through it's characters to check if it fits the standard norms (6 char min ,only alphabets and numbers ....)

Parameters
password
char*

The password of the member.

Returns
if the password is valid

Returns 0

if not

Returns 1

HIDE_PASSWORD
void HIDE_PASSWORD(
char *password
)

Takes a pointer to the password as user input to hide it by displaying asterisks '*'

Parameters
password
char*

The password of the member.

Encrypt_Password
int Encrypt_Password(
char *password
)

Takes the password as a parameter and browse through it's characters by adding a random generated number to the ASCII value of the characters.  The random number will be our Encryption key.

Parameters
password
char*

The password of the member.

Returns

The Encryption Key

See Also

myRand

Decrypt_Password
void Decrypt_Password(
char *password,
int Encryption_Key
)

Takes the password as a parameter and browse through it's characters by substracting The Encryption Key number from the ASCII value of the characters.

Parameters
password
char*

The password of the member.

Encryption_Key
int

The number that will decrypt the password

Update_Borrowing_Infos
void Update_Borrowing_Infos(
char Borrow_Return,
Member_infos *ADHERANT_INFOS,
Borrowing_Infos *LOAN,
Film_Infos *FILM
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the Film Database:

Borrow Mode

Borrowing a film will increment the number of the available copies

Return Mode

Returning a film will decrement the number of the available copies

It uses  CHANGE_COPIES_NUMB_LINE to update The database

It handles also the borrowing guidelines by checking if the category of the film corresponds to the member.

Parameters
Borrow_Return
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "B" for borrow /"R" for return

ADHERANT_INFOS
Member_infos*

The member info structure used to inform us on the member category. i.e: "Firstname ,Adress , Phonenumber..."

LOAN
Borrowing_Infos*

The Loan structure to hold the Borrowing infos i.e: Date ,Code ...

FILM
Film_Infos*

The Film structure which will be holding the film infos

See Also

CHANGE_COPIES_NUMB_LINE / SEARCH_ID / nullcheck

Customize_File
int Customize_File(
char Borrow_Return,
Borrowing_Infos *LOAN,
Film_Infos *FILM,
char *Borrower
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the Personal Borrowed films Database:

Borrow Mode

If the user try to borrow a file His customized file will get updated and a new film is added

Return Mode

If the user try to return a file The line which contains the borrowed film in his file will be removed

It uses  Customize_Name to retrieve the Personal file name.

Parameters
Borrow_Return
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "B" for borrow /"R" for return

LOAN
Borrowing_Infos*

The Loan structure to hold the Borrowing infos i.e: Date ,Code ...

FILM
Film_Infos*

The Film structure which will be holding the film infos

Borrower
char*

The name of the borrower which is necessary to generate his/her personal file.

Returns

It returns two types of values depending on the mode used on:

Borrow Mode

Returns ALREADY_BORROWED = 1 meaning that Film is already borrowed by the member

Return Mode

Returns DOES_NOT_EXIST = 1 meaning that The memeber is trying to return a film which wasn't borrowed.

See Also

Customize_Name / < SEARCH_ID > / DELETE_LINE / linecount / nullcheck

Borrowers_Record
void Borrowers_Record(
char Borrow_Return,
Borrowing_Infos *LOAN,
char *Borrower
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the Global Borrowers Database:

Borrow Mode

Append a new borrower to the Database

Return Mode

Delete a specific borrower after he returns all the films

Parameters
Borrow_Return
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "B" for borrow /"R" for return

LOAN
Borrowing_Infos*

The Loan structure to hold the Borrowing infos i.e: Date ,Code ...

Borrower
char*

The name of the borrower which is necessary to generate his/her personal file.

See Also

Customize_Name / SEARCH_ID / CHECK_IF_EXIST / DELETE_LINE / linecount / nullcheck

FILM_Record
void FILM_Record(
char Borrow_Return,
Borrowing_Infos *LOAN,
Film_Infos *FILM
)

This functions is used on Double mode especially to interact with the Global Borrowed films Database:

Borrow Mode

Borrowing will increment the numbers of borrowed copies or append the film if it doesn't exist

Return Mode

Returning will decrement the copies numb and delete the film line if the copies are exhausted

Parameters
Borrow_Return
char

It denotes The mode which will the function be used in i.e: "B" for borrow /"R" for return

LOAN
Borrowing_Infos*

The Loan structure to hold the Borrowing infos i.e: Date ,Code ...

FILM
Film_Infos*

The Film structure which will be holding the film infos

See Also

SEARCH_ID / CHECK_IF_EXIST / DELETE_LINE / linecount / nullcheck
